verses.verse: Again he entered the synagogue, and there was a man there who had a withered hand.
They watched him whether he would heal on the Sabbath, so they might accuse him.
He said to the man who had the withered hand, "Stand here up front."
And he said to them, "Is it lawful to do good on the Sabbath or to do evil, to save life or kill?" But they remained silent.

And after he had looked around on them with anger, grieved because of the hardness of their hearts, he said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." He stretched it out, and his hand was fully restored, even as the other.
Then the Pharisees went out and immediately took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might kill him.
But Jesus withdrew himself along with his disciples to the sea, and a great multitude from Galilee followed him and also from Judea,
Jerusalem, Idumea, the other side of Jordan, and those around Tyre and Sidon, a very large crowd. When they had heard what great things he did, they came to him.
He spoke to his disciples that a small ship should be ready for him, because of the multitude, lest they crowd him,
for he had healed many, so that they, as many as had diseases, pressed around him, so they could touch him.
And unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him and shouted, "You are the Son the God,"
but he strictly ordered them that they should not make him known.
He then went up a mountain and called whom he wanted, and they came to him.
He appointed twelve, that they should be with him and that he might send them out to preach,
to have authority to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:
Simon, he surnamed Peter;
James, the son of Zebedee and John, the brother of James, and he surnamed them Boanerges, which means, the sons of thunder;
Andrew; Philip, Bartholomew; Matthew; Thomas; James, the son of Alphaeus; Thaddaeus; Simon the Canaanite,
and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him, then they entered a house.
Then the multitude came together again, so that they could not even eat bread.
When his friends heard [this], they went out to grab him, for they said, "He is insane."
The Scribes who came from Jerusalem said, "He has Beelzebub, and he casts out devils by the prince of devils."
And he called them and said to them in parables, "How can Satan cast out Satan?
"And if a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
"And if a family is divided against itself, that family cannot stand.
"And if Satan rises up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand but has an end.
"No one can enter a strong man's house and seize his possessions unless he first ties up the strong man, then he can plunder his house.
"Truly I say to you, Â«All sins will be forgiven the sons of men and blasphemies as many as they will blaspheme.
"But the one who will blaspheme the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness but is in danger of eternal damnation."
[He said this] because they said, "He has an unclean spirit."
Then his brothers and mother came and standing outside they sent [word] to him, asking for him.
And the multitude sat around him and said to him, "Look, your mother and brothers are outside looking for you."
He answered them, saying, "Who is my mother or my brothers?"
And he looked around on those who sat around him and said, "See my mother and my brothers.
"For whoever will do the will of God, that same is my brother and sister and mother."
